edu.uci.calismall

Class GhostStrokeHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.ScaleGestureDetector.SimpleOnScaleGestureListener
      • edu.uci.calismall.GenericTouchHandler
        • edu.uci.calismall.GhostStrokeHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ScaleGestureDetector.OnScaleGestureListener, TouchHandler

    public class GhostStrokeHandler
extends GenericTouchHandler
    Intercepts touch events that may involve ghost stroke "revive" buttons.

    Whenever a temporary scrap is deselected, its outer border is displayed using a solid line (as opposed to the dotted one in use for temporary scraps) and a small pencil is shown on its top-leftmost point. Both the line and the pencil start fading; if the pencil button is clicked before it's completed fading out, the stroke is "revived", meaning that it's drawn with its original solid color. This handler checks whether a touch event involves any of these ghost strokes currently displayed.

    Author:
    Michele Bonazza

      Constructors

      GhostStrokeHandler(CaliView parent)
      Creates a new handler that takes care of touch events whenever ghost strokes are being displayed.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addGhost(Stroke ghost)
      Adds the argument stroke to the list of ghost strokes.
      void deleteOldStrokes()
      Deletes all ghost strokes marked as to be deleted (because they faded out).
      void drawGhosts(Canvas canvas, Paint paint)
      Draws all ghost strokes to the argument canvas, using the argument paint.
      boolean onDown(PointF touchPoint)
      Called when an MotionEvent.ACTION_DOWN is detected, that is whenever the first touch event is detected for an action.
      boolean onMove(PointF touchPoint)
      Called when an MotionEvent.ACTION_MOVE is detected, that is whenever any of the previously detected touch pointers is dragged along the screen.
      boolean onUp(PointF touchPoint)
      Called when an MotionEvent.ACTION_DOWN is detected, that is whenever the last pointer is destroyed because the user lifted all her fingers/styluses from the screen.
      void setGhostAnimationOnPause(boolean isPaused)
      Sets whether ghost fade out animations must be executed, and whether all ghost revive buttons for all ghost strokes must be drawn.

        public void setGhostAnimationOnPause(boolean isPaused)

        Parameters:
        isPaused - true if ghost animations should be paused and revive buttons not be drawn
